text: You were walking towards the place where people asked for your help.
You arrive at the dimly lit town of San Gubat. The air is heavy with fear.
Who do you seek for information first?

choices.text: Find the old Albularyo (Healer) at the edge of town.
Report to the Barangay Captain at the town hall.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: I should find the old Albularyo at the edge of town. Maybe he can tell me more about this creature.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: Good evening, Albularyo. Can you help me? What am I dealing with?

text.speaker: Albularyo
text.text: It has wings like a bat and separates at the waist.

text.speaker: Albularyo
text.text: Here, take this salt. The Manananggal despises it.

text: You've gained Asin.

choices.text: Thank him and head to the old church where it was last seen.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: The captain might know something about these attacks. I need to report immediately.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: Captain, I need your guidance. What kind of creature am I facing?

text.speaker: Captain
text.text: My best men have vanished. We believe it's a Wakwak, a different kind of horror. This might keep it at bay.

text.speaker: Captain
text.text: Here, take this braid of garlic.

text: You've gained Bawang.

choices.text: Nod grimly and head to the old church where it was last seen.

text: The ancient church is silent, its stone walls covered in moss.
Dust motes dance in the single moonbeam piercing the roof.
Do you investigate the crumbling bell tower or the desecrated altar?

choices.text: Climb the creaking stairs to the bell tower.
Inspect the altar at the far end of the church.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: I hear something above... I need to prepare myself for whatever's up there.

text.speaker: Wakwak
text.text: Who dares disturb my feast?!

text.speaker: Wakwak
text.text: Prepare to be devoured!

text: It's a Wakwak, feasting on a goat.
It turns its glowing red eyes on you!

choices.text: Thrust the garlic braid at it!
You have no garlic! Fight it with your bolo!
This isn't a Manananggal. The salt is useless here.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: Take this! The garlic should weaken it.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: I strike with my bolo as it recoils.

text.speaker: Wakwak
text.text: Aaaahhh!

text: It shrieks and flies off into the night, dropping something shiny.
You've found an Agimat.

choices.text: You found an Agimat! Continue to the rice fields.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: Without garlic, I have no advantage. I need to fight with what I have!

text.speaker: Wakwak
text.text: You are no match for me!

text: It claws you deeply before you can land a solid blow.
You lose 30 HP.

choices.text: Wounded, you limp towards the rice fields.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: Let's check the altar. Something feels off here.

text: The altar is overturned.
Behind it, you find a small, intricately carved amulet throbbing with a faint warmth.
It feels protective.
You've found an Agimat.

choices.text: With the amulet secured, you head towards the rice fields.

text: The moon hangs high over the vast, dark rice paddies.
The air is still, save for the chirping of crickets.
In the distance, you hear the faint sound of a baby crying.

choices.text: It's a trap. A Tiyanak. Ignore it and press on.
It could be a real child! Investigate the sound.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: That crying... could be a trap, but I can't ignore it.

text.speaker: Tiyanak
text.text: Hehehe, come closer, human! My teeth hunger!

text: A small, monstrous creature leaps out, biting your leg before scurrying away!
It was a Tiyanak!

choices.text: You fell for the oldest trick in the book! (Lose 25 HP)
Your Agimat glows, repelling the creature before it can bite!

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: I was fooled! Its bite is painful!

text: You lose 25 HP.
You curse your foolishness and continue towards the ominous Balete tree.

choices.text: Continue, more cautious than before.

text: You've reached the heart of the darkness: a massive, ancient Balete tree with thick, hanging roots.
You can hear a sickening squelching sound from above.
The Manananggal is here. This is the final battle.

choices.text: Charge the tree and attack the creature head-on!
Remember the lore. Search for the lower half of its body.

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: I need to face it head-on. I must be careful!

text.speaker: Manananggal
text.text: How dare you come near me, human?!

text.speaker: Manananggal
text.text: You won't leave this place alive!

text: It swoops down, its claws tearing at you.
Your bravery costs you dearly.
You lose 50 HP.

choices.text: You're heavily wounded! You must find its lower half!

text.speaker: Hunter
text.text: I must find its lower half. This is my only chance!

text: Hidden among the gnarled roots, you find it: the creature's vulnerable lower torso, standing motionless.

choices.text: Pour the holy salt into the torso!
You don't have salt! Hack at it with your bolo!

text: As the salt touches the flesh, the torso erupts in black smoke.

text.speaker: Manananggal
text: "No... this cannot be...!"
High above, the winged creature gives a final, agonizing shriek and disintegrates into dust.
The sun begins to rise.
You have saved San Gubat.
Your bolo cuts deep, but it's not enough.

text.speaker: Manananggal
text: "You dare strike me without the salt?!"
The creature swoops down, enraged, and impales you with its sharp tongue.
Your lack of the proper tool was your undoing.
GAME OVER.
Your wounds are too severe.
You collapse, and the darkness consumes you.
Your hunt ends in failure.
GAME OVER.
